intro: Bidens fulvescens, commonly known as the yellow beggar's ticks, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its yellow flowers with prominent black centers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands, roadsides, and other open areas. It produces small, three-lobed leaves and has a taproot system that allows it to thrive in various environmental conditions. Bidens fulvescens is often used in traditional medicine and is also considered a weed in agricultural settings.
